Columns

By default, the Cadenza horizontal grid system is based on a standard 12-column and fractional grid. You can either use the simple classes, extend the placeholders, or use a mixin to make a column.

Settings
$grid-columns: 12 !default;
$grid-column-gutter: 1rem !default;
$grid-column-mqs: (all, small, medium, large);
Exports
  • .col - column
  • .cols Parent columns

No Gutter

col-{{col_width}}

Gutter

col-{{col_width}}

Exports
  • .col-[n] - column spanning n rows
  • .cols-[n] - parent of columns each spanning n rows
  • .col-offset-[n] - column offset from left using margin
  • .col-push-[n] - column pushed from left using left
  • .col-pull-[n] - column pushed from right (pulled) using right

Rows

With Cadenza, you can implement a vertical grid system in your layouts alongside a horizontal grid system. A row is much like a row in any other framework; that is, they are full-width and able to contain columns. However, the biggest difference in Cadenza is that you can manipulate the size and layout of rows in much the same way as you can for columns.

Settings
$grid-rows: 12 !default;
$grid-row-gutter: 1rem !default;
$grid-row-mqs: (all, short, tall, small);

Stacks

Stacks are blocks of content (including columns and rows) that become full-width, auto-height, stacked blocks within a given breakpoint.

Exports
  • .stack-[mq] - stacked block within [mq] breakpoint
